intro: Carex ischnogyne, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sedges, is a species of flowering plant in the sedge family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. This plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes, wetlands, and along the edges of streams. It plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates. Carex ischnogyne is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
